ticketpy package¶

ticketpy.ticketpy module¶

Client/library for Ticketmaster’s Discovery API

class ticketpy.ticketpy.ApiClient(api_key, version='v2', response_type='json')¶

Bases: object

ApiClient for the Ticketmaster Discovery API

Request URLs end up looking like: http://app.ticketmaster.com/discovery/v2/events.json?apikey={api_key}

api_key¶

API key

attractions_url¶

URL for /attractions/

base_url = 'https://app.ticketmaster.com'¶
events_url¶

URL for /events/

response_type = None¶

Response type (json, xml...)

url¶

Root URL

venues_url¶

URL for /venues/

exception ticketpy.ticketpy.ApiException(url, params, response)¶

Bases: Exception

Exception thrown for API-related error messages

class ticketpy.ticketpy.Event(event_id=None, name=None, start_date=None, start_time=None, status=None, genres=None, price_ranges=None, venues=None, utc_datetime=None)¶

Bases: object

Ticketmaster event.

The JSON returned from the Discovery API (at least, as far as what’s being used here) looks like:

{
    "name": "Event name",
    "dates": {
        "start": {
            "localDate": "2019-04-01",
            "localTime": "2019-04-01T23:00:00Z"
        },
        "status": {
            "code": "onsale"
        }
    },
    "classifications": [
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Rock"
            }
        },
        {
            "genre": {
                "name": "Funk"
            }
        }
    ],
    "priceRanges": [
        {
            "min": 10,
            "max": 25
        }
    ],
    "_embedded": {
        "venues": [
            {
                "name": "The Tabernacle"
            }
        ]
    }
}
static from_json(json_event)¶

Creates an Event from API’s JSON response

Parameters:json_event – Deserialized JSON object from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Event
genres = None¶

List of genre classifications

local_start_date = None¶

Local start date (YYYY-MM-DD)

local_start_time = None¶

Local start time (HH:MM:SS)

price_ranges = None¶

Price ranges found for tickets

status = None¶

Sale status (such as Cancelled, Offsale...)

utc_datetime¶

Start date/time in UTC (Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

Returns:Start date/time in UTC
Return type:datetime
venues = None¶

List of ticketpy.Venue objects associated with this event

class ticketpy.ticketpy.Page(number, size, total_elements, total_pages, link_self, link_next, embedded)¶

class ticketpy.ticketpy.PageIterator(api_client, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Iterates through API response pages

all()¶

Returns a flat list of all results. Queries all possible pages.

Use limit() to restrict the number of calls being made.

Returns:Flat list of results
api_client = None¶

Parent API client

current_page = None¶

Current page number

end_page = None¶

Final page number

limit(max_pages=10)¶

Limit the number of page requests. Default: 5

With a default page size of 20, limit(max_pages=5 would return a maximum of 200 items (fewer, if there are fewer results).

Use this to contain the number of API calls being made, as the API restricts users to a maximum of 5,000 per day. Very broad searches can return a large number of pages.

To contrast, all() will automatically request every page available.

Parameters:max_pages – Maximum number of pages to request. Default: 10. Set to None (or use all()) to return all pages.
Returns:Flat list of results from pages
next()¶
page = None¶

Current page

start_page = None¶

Initial page number

class ticketpy.ticketpy.Venue(name=None, address=None, city=None, state_code=None, postal_code=None, latitude=None, longitude=None, markets=None, url=None, box_office_info=None, dmas=None, general_info=None, venue_id=None, social=None, timezone=None, images=None, parking_detail=None, accessible_seating_detail=None)¶

Bases: object

A Ticketmaster venue

The JSON returned from the Discovery API looks something like this (edited for brevity):

{
    "id": "KovZpaFEZe",
    "name": "The Tabernacle",
    "url": "http://www.ticketmaster.com/venue/115031",
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "address": {
        "line1": "152 Luckie Street"
    },
    "city": {
        "name": "Atlanta"
    },
    "postalCode": "30303",
    "state": {
        "stateCode": "GA",
        "name": "Georgia"
    },
    "country": {
        "name": "United States Of America",
        "countryCode": "US"
    },
    "location": {
        "latitude": "33.758688",
        "longitude": "-84.391449"
    },
    "social": {
        "twitter": {
            "handle": "@TabernacleATL"
        }
    },
    "markets": [
        {
            "id": "10"
        }
    ]
}
address = None¶

Street address (first line)

city = None¶

City name

static from_json(json_venue)¶

Create a Venue object from the API response’s JSON data

Parameters:json_venue – Deserialized JSON from API response
Returns:ticketpy.Venue
general_info = None¶

General info on the venue

images = None¶

Ticketmaster venue image links

latitude = None¶

Latitude

location¶

All location-based data (full address, lat/lon, timezone

longitude = None¶

Longitude

markets = None¶

List of market IDs

name = None¶

Venue’s name

parking_detail = None¶

Parking details

postal_code = None¶

Zip/postal code

social = None¶

Social media links (Twitter, etc)

state_code = None¶

State code (ex: ‘GA’ not ‘Georgia’)

timezone = None¶

Timezone venue’s located in

url = None¶

Ticketmaster internal venue URL

venue_id = None¶

Venue ID (use to look up events)
